1.name: Mildred Pierce
1.description: A hard-working mother inches towards disaster as she divorces her husband and starts a successful restaurant business to support her spoiled daughter.

2.name: Brief Encounter
2.description: Meeting a stranger in a railway station, a woman is tempted to cheat on her husband.

3.name: Spellbound
3.description: A psychiatrist protects the identity of an amnesia patient accused of murder while attempting to recover his memory.

4.name: Roma città aperta
4.description: During the Nazi occupation of Rome in 1944, the Resistance leader, Giorgio Manfredi, is chased by the Nazis as he seeks refuge and a way to escape.

5.name: The Way to the Stars
5.description: The wartime daily routine on a British bomber base in southeastern England is revealed through the eyes of newly arrived Flying Officer Peter Penrose.

6.name: The Lost Weekend
6.description: The desperate life of a chronic alcoholic is followed through a four-day drinking bout.

7.name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
7.description: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.

8.name: Detour
8.description: Chance events trap hitch-hiker Al Roberts in a tightening net of film noir trouble.

9.name: And Then There Were None
9.description: Seven guests, a newly hired personal secretary and two staff are gathered on an isolated island by an absent host and someone begins killing them off one by one. They work together to determine who is the killer?

10.name: Les enfants du paradis
10.description: The theatrical life of a beautiful courtesan and the four men who love her.

11.name: Anchors Aweigh
11.description: Two sailors, one naive, the other experienced in the ways of the world, on liberty in Los Angeles, is the setting for this movie musical.

12.name: Scarlet Street
12.description: When a man in mid-life crisis befriends a young woman, her venal fiancé persuades her to con him out of the fortune they mistakenly assume he possesses.

13.name: Leave Her to Heaven
13.description: A writer falls in love with a young socialite and they're soon married. But her obsessive love for him threatens to be the undoing of them both, and everyone else around them.

14.name: Fallen Angel
14.description: A slick con man arrives in a small town looking to make some money, but soon gets more than he bargained for.

15.name: State Fair
15.description: The Frake family attends the annual Iowa State Fair; each member of the clan has their own reason for doing so.

16.name: They Were Expendable
16.description: The PT boat unit Motor Torpedo Boat Squadron Three defends the Philippines from Japanese invasion during World War II.

17.name: Dakota
17.description: In 1871 Dakota, two crooked businessmen oppose the local wheat farmers and the railroad development, in order to control the town of Fargo.

18.name: Dead of Night
18.description: An architect senses impending doom as his half-remembered recurring dream turns into reality. The guests at the country house encourage him to stay as they take turns telling supernatural tales.

19.name: The Bells of St. Mary's
19.description: At a big city Catholic school, Father O'Malley and Sister Benedict indulge in friendly rivalry, and succeed in extending the school through the gift of a building.

20.name: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
20.description: Encouraged by her idealistic if luckless father, a bright and imaginative young woman comes of age in a Brooklyn tenement during the early 1900s.

21.name: Her Highness and the Bellboy
21.description: A bellboy at a swanky New York hotel starts to ignore his girlfriend after meeting a beautiful European princess.

22.name: Conflict
22.description: An engineer trapped in an unhappy marriage murders his wife in the hope of marrying her younger sister.

23.name: Blithe Spirit
23.description: Charles and his second wife, Ruth, are haunted by the spirit of his first wife, Elvira. Medium Madame Arcati tries to help things out by contacting the ghost.

24.name: Without Love
24.description: In World War II Washington DC, Jamie Rowan, enters a loveless marriage with scientist Pat Jamieson and becomes his assistant. Struggles bring them closer together.

25.name: The Enchanted Cottage
25.description: A homely maid and a scarred ex-GI meet at the cottage where she works and where he was to spend his honeymoon prior to his accident. The two develop a bond and agree to marry, more out of ...                See full summary »

26.name: Ziegfeld Follies
26.description: The late, great impresario Florenz Ziegfeld Jr. looks down from Heaven and ordains a new revue in his grand old style.

27.name: House of Dracula
27.description: Count Dracula and the Wolf Man seek cures for their afflictions; a hunchbacked woman, a mad scientist and Frankenstein's Monster have their own troubles.

28.name: Caesar and Cleopatra
28.description: At the height of the Roman Civil War, a young Cleopatra meets a middle-aged Julius Caesar, who teaches her how to rule Egypt.

29.name: Hangover Square
29.description: A promising classical musician finds his life poisoned by a music hall dancer -- and by the strange gaps in his memory.

30.name: Back to Bataan
30.description: In 1942, after the fall of the Philippines to the Japanese, U.S. Army Col. Joseph Madden stays behind to organize the local resistance against the Japanese invaders.

31.name: A Walk in the Sun
31.description: During WWII, a platoon of American soldiers trudge through the Italian countryside in search of a bridge they have been ordered to blow up, encountering danger and destruction along the way.

32.name: 'I Know Where I'm Going!'
32.description: A young Englishwoman goes to the Hebrides to marry her older, wealthier fiancé. When the weather keeps them separated on different islands, she begins to have second thoughts.

33.name: Christmas in Connecticut
33.description: A food writer who has lied about being the perfect housewife must try to cover her deception when her boss and a returning war hero invite themselves to her home for a traditional family Christmas.

34.name: The Woman in Green
34.description: Sherlock Holmes investigates when young women around London turn up murdered, each with a finger severed off. Scotland Yard suspects a madman, but Holmes believes the killings to be part of a diabolical plot.

35.name: Rhapsody in Blue
35.description: George Gershwin is a driven composer whose need to succeed destroys his relationship with singer Julie Adams and socialite Christine Gilbert.

36.name: The Bullfighters
36.description: Bumbling detective Stan Laurel disguises himself as a famous matador in order to hide from the vengeful Richard K. Muldoon, who spent time in prison on Stan's bogus testimony.

37.name: Our Vines Have Tender Grapes
37.description: A Norwegian farmer lovingly raises his daughter in rural World War II-era Benson Junction, Wisconsin.

38.name: A Thousand and One Nights
38.description: Tongue-in-cheek fantasy film set in Baghdad and loosely based on the One Thousand and One Nights medieval story.

39.name: The Clock
39.description: In 1945, during a 48-hour leave, a soldier accidentally meets a girl at Pennsylvania Station and spends his leave with her, eventually falling in love with the lovely New Yorker.

40.name: The Body Snatcher
40.description: A ruthless doctor and his young prize student find themselves continually harassed by their murderous supplier of illegal cadavers.

41.name: Captain Kidd
41.description: The unhistorical adventures of pirate Captain Kidd revolve around treasure and treachery.

42.name: Dick Tracy
42.description: Police detective Dick Tracy must identify and apprehend a serial killer known as Splitface.

43.name: Story of G.I. Joe
43.description: During WW2, Pulitzer prize winner and war correspondent Ernie Pyle joins the army and writes articles about his comrades in his daily columns.

44.name: The Southerner
44.description: The life of the poor Tucker family, that worked as cotton pluggers and decided to get their own ground, but nature is against them.

45.name: My Name Is Julia Ross
45.description: Julia Ross secures employment, through a rather nosy employment agency, with a wealthy widow, Mrs. Hughes, and goes to live at her house. 2 days later, she awakens - in a different house, ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Corn Is Green
46.description: A schoolteacher becomes the mentor of a talented young miner and seeks to get him into a university.

47.name: Cornered
47.description: Canadian flyer Laurence Gerard finds that his wife has been murdered by a French collaborator. His quest for justice leads him to Switzerland and Argentina.

48.name: The Valley of Decision
48.description: An Irish maid falls for the son of her wealthy boss, though their disapproving fathers and a bitter strike at the steel mill complicates matters.

49.name: Blood on the Sun
49.description: A dedicated American reporter in 1930s Japan is determined to expose that government's plan for world domination.

50.name: Lady on a Train
50.description: While in a train halted at a station, Nikki Collins witnesses a murder committed in a nearby building. When she brings the police to the scene of the crime, they think she's crazy since ...                See full summary »
